Kirsty Hawkins researches music cognition, specifically the management and organisation of musical information in working memory. Her PhD project is under the supervision of [Daniel Mullensiefen](https://www.gold.ac.uk/psychology/staff/mullensiefen/). Kirsty is developing a novel music-based measure for prioritisation, with the aim of using this to improve general working memory.

Beyond her Ph.D work, Kirsty has a number of part-time positions both in and outside of academia. Notably, [OntoSync](www.ontosync.com) is a startup organisation rooted in cognitive psychology that Kirsty works closely with as the Research and Project Delivery Lead. Kirsty also works as a Research Officer for [PRS for Music](https://www.prsformusic.com/), ensuring music royalties are distributed to musicians timely and accurately. Kirsty uses these experiences as well as teaching roles inform her research.
